programme.desc: 65/104. Tha Bing a' cur Hoppity air sgèith ach 's e turas obann a tha gu bhith aig an dèideag! Bing is having fun making Hoppity fly, but Hoppity is about to take an unexpected trip!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: 66/104. Tha Bing 's a charaidean nan rannsachairean-nàdar 's iad a' sgrùdadh sa ghàrradh aig Ama. Bing and his friends are nature explorers today as they investigate finds in Ama's garden.

programme.title: Pompon Am Mathan Beag/Pompon Little Bear
programme.desc: 12/39. Pompon can't sleep and thinks that he is nocturnal, just like Ita. With a lesson or two from Adi, a neighbouring bat, Pompon soon realises that he's not nocturnal.

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc: 40/80. Mòrag Anna NicNèill a' leughadh An Oidhche Mhìorbhaileach aig Bèibidh Broc. Morag Ann MacNeil reads An Oidhche Mhìorbhaileach aig Bèibidh Broc.

programme.title: An Teaghlach Rìoghail an...
programme.desc: ...Ath-dhoras/The Royals Next Door. 5/52. Tha Stella 'son sealltainn do Mhia is Freya na sgilean campachaidh aic'. Stella wants to show Mia and Freya her camping skills.

programme.title: An Teaghlach Rìoghail an...
programme.desc: ...Ath-dhoras/The Royals Next Door. 6/52. Tha òraidean rin toirt seachad an-diug. Speeches are to be delivered today.

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc: 5/5. Tha Mason a' lorg na bha a dhìth air aig a' bhùth-shiubhail: trì Dads! Mason finds what he's looking for in the mobile shop: three dads!

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc: 6/12. Tha Rachel a' farpais an aghaidh preasantairean CBBC ALBA ach saoil cò shoirbhicheas? Rachel competes against the CBBC ALBA presenters but who will emerge victorious?

programme.title: Flix
programme.desc: 6/13. Tha Flix ag ionnsachadh rud no dha bho mhàirneal an-diugh. Flix learns a few things from detention today.

programme.title: An Là
programme.desc: Naidheachdan ionadail, nàiseanta is eadar-nàiseanta gach là cuide ri fiosrachadh coimhearsnachd bho BBC ALBA. Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA.

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: 15/20. The local dance troupe are in distress, a situation which calls for careful handling of a musical score.

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: 8/13. Drama Gàidhlig stèidhichte ann an Leòdhas. Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis.

programme.title: Skipinnish Shorts
programme.desc: 1/10. Skipinnish le Land Below the Waves aig cuirm-chiùil bho Chaisteal Dhùn Èideann. Skipinnish perform Land Below the Waves at a concert from Edinburgh Castle.

programme.title: Rùm Gu Rùm, Le Erica
programme.desc: 6/6. Tha Erica Mhoireasdan a' dol air turas dealbhachaidh chruthachail tron Ghàidhealtachd 's na h-Eileanan. Erica Morrison goes on a creative design adventure through Scotland.

programme.title: Cu Leis Thu? | A Puppy for Padruig
programme.desc: 6/6. Peter meets some rescue dogs before making a final decision about his new puppy companion. Coinnichidh Pàdruig ri coin theasairgte mus dèan e co-dhùnadh mun chompanach ùr aige.

programme.title: Crowdie And Cream/Gruth is Uachdar
programme.desc: 3/3. Drama series based on Finlay J MacDonald's account of 1930s life in the Scottish Hebrides. Hector advertises for a wife, Finlay attends school in Tarbert and war is declared.

programme.title: Cuirm aig Celtic: Ceolas @ 30
programme.desc: 2/2. Music and conversation from Ceòlas @ 30 at Celtic Connections. Featuring a stellar line-up of musical guests from the Hebrides to Cape Breton for an island cèilidh like no other.

programme.title: Baile na h-Ola (Aberdeen: When Oil Came to Town)
programme.desc: Am buaidh thug ola air baile thar 50 bliadhna. The impact of oil on a city over 50 years.

programme.title: The Death of Yugoslavia
programme.desc: 4/6. President Milosevic is implicated as the man directly behind ethnic cleansing in Bosnia. Contains some strong language, prolonged violence and disturbing scenes.

programme.title: The Death of Yugoslavia
programme.desc: 5/6. The story of three years of international failure in Bosnia. The main participants tell how promises to the Bosnian Muslims were made and broken. Contains some violence and disturbing scenes.

programme.title: A Summer Journey with Angela Rippon
programme.desc: 2/6. Angela Rippon continues her journey down the River Severn.

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: 2/4. Life on England's waterways with Robbie Cumming. Robbie gets stuck in the mud in Woodseaves Cutting and explores the charming canal-side village of Kinver in Staffordshire.

programme.title: Mario Vargas Llosa: The Story...
programme.desc: ...of the Novelist Who Would Be President - Omnibus. Documentary following novelist Mario Vargas Llosa in his bid to become president of Peru. Contains some strong language and upsetting scenes.

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings who Made Britain
programme.desc: 2/3. How George II had to adapt to a society no longer content with being downtrodden subjects.

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City

programme.title: New: Love Island
programme.desc: Week six in Love Island 2025 is almost at an end, and the pressure is building by the day in the nation's favourite villa as nobody is ready to say goodbye with the stakes so high.

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Most Interesting Man in the World: US animated comedy. After being told by Lois how stupid he is, Peter accepts more business trips away and soon becomes clever and cultured.

programme.desc: The officers protecting Australia's borders see some very unusual things. Cameras capture first-hand how they deal with drug-runners, smugglers and strange bugs. (S8, ep 7)

programme.desc: A Brazilian man hiding a large quantity of cocaine is busted at Auckland Airport. Plus, a woman with undeclared seeds loses her cool with Biosecurity. (S11, ep 7)

programme.desc: Immigration deal with a Chinese national using a fake passport, while custom discover a huge stash of meth hidden among household items. (S11, ep 8)

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities Rickie Williams, Melvin Odoom and Laura Crane, and those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity special of the classic game show, with Charlotte Church, Melvin Odoom and Katherine Ryan all trying to say what they see, as they guess well-known phrases for the chance to win a £50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: Competitive brothers Jack and Rob from Manchester, couple Rosie and Wes from London, and word-loving Jenny and Dev from Nantwich use their powers of deduction to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. The last remaining duo have the opportunity to win the money they've banked earlier in the show to potentially double their winnings, or leaving with nothing. Adil Ray asks the questions

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Stephen from Cheltenham, Maurice from Manchester, Maryanne from Fife and Dawn from Chesterfield pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Tracy is shocked when she gets some news, Cain's anger boils over and Sarah is worried about Charity after her kind offer

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: With Kit facing life-saving surgery following his confrontation with Mick, Sarah and Bernie sit at his bedside. Nick tackles David about Lily's behaviour, Debbie refuses to concede defeat, and Lauren invites Aadi to join her and Frankie for tea

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of two women trying to find birth parents after half a century apart. Ann Melbourne found her birth mother over a decade ago and now wants to locate her birth father Leslie, who she has limited information about in her adoption paperwork, while Amanda Village is searching for her mother Susan, who gave her up for adoption

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's classic adventure thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Robert Shaw and Richard Dreyfuss. The Atlantic resort of Amity Island is preparing for its lucrative summer season when death strikes in the form of a Great White shark. Rather than turn away business, Mayor Vaughn orders police chief Brody to keep the beaches open.

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 11, as the riders returned to the saddle after a rest day to face a flat 156.8km route starting and finishing in Toulouse. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Alex Dowsett and Peter Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James cooks a dish of lamb from the salt marshes of Wales, learns how to cook Richard Bertinet's puffballs and gives a masterclass in the right way to make custard. He also serves classic French cuisine for his guest Lisa Snowdon and chefs Claude Bosi and Jonny Lake

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy

programme.title: Creed II
programme.desc: Boxing drama starring Michael B Jordan and Sylvester Stallone. Three years after he began training with the legendary Rocky Balboa, Adonis "Donnie" Creed has taken the title of world heavyweight champion. When Russian fighter Viktor Drago, whose father Ivan killed Donnie's dad in the ring decades prior, challenges the young American to a show bout, Donnie and Rocky find their relationship strained. Can the pair work things out? And can Donnie find the inner strength to avenge his father?

programme.title: The People's History Show
programme.desc: Reporters travel the country to reveal more stories from Scotland's past, beginning with a visit to the unique village of New Lanark. The programme then heads to Fife to examine one of the worst accidents in Scotland's coal-mining history, and explores how the 1988 Garden Festival transformed Glasgow

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Gary Imlach presents a look back at the 10 stages of the prestigious race, as the riders enjoy the first rest day. With reports by Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Sarah was left in the stairwell of a Surrey car park in 2001. She is the youngest foundling to appear on the show. Also looking for answers is Chris who, at three months old, was dropped off at a childminder's near Kings Cross in London, 62 years ago. He still needs to know who his birth family is and why nobody ever returned to pick him up. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell host

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara.
